name: arXiv
suggested_use_for_ai: Primary preprint server for cutting-edge STEM research. Use for latest ML/AI/physics/math papers before peer review. Access via API for bulk ingestion.
notes: Not peer-reviewed by arXiv itself; unverified claims. Supports API access for machine ingestion. Categories: cs.AI, cs.LG, math.*, physics.*, etc.

name: ACL Anthology
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical repository for NLP and computational linguistics. 118k+ papers from ACL, EMNLP, and related venues. Open-source metadata on GitHub enables bulk retrieval.
notes: Peer-reviewed proceedings. Open metadata facilitates API integration without web scraping. 50+ years of linguistic research.

name: Google Scholar
suggested_use_for_ai: Broad academic discovery across publishers, preprints, theses, courts. Good first-stop index for scholarly literature discovery and citation tracking.
notes: Aggregates across paywalled and open sources. Supports filtered search by discipline and date.

name: JSTOR
suggested_use_for_ai: Archive of millions of journal articles, books, and primary sources across 75+ disciplines. Especially strong in humanities and social sciences.
notes: Non-profit digital library. Often requires institutional access; free trials available.

name: Semantic Scholar
suggested_use_for_ai: AI-powered research discovery with semantic search and citation analysis. Particularly strong in CS and AI. Provides paper influence and relationship mapping.
notes: Free access. API available. Focuses on understanding paper influence and connections.

name: DOAJ (Directory of Open Access Journals)
suggested_use_for_ai: Curated index of legitimate peer-reviewed open-access journals across science, tech, medicine, social sciences, and humanities.
notes: Guarantees free, peer-reviewed access. Quality-controlled index.

name: PubMed
suggested_use_for_ai: Premier database for biomedical and life sciences literature. Indexes millions of citations with links to full text where available.
notes: Free access to abstracts; full text availability varies by publisher and license.

name: NASA ADS (Astrophysics Data System)
suggested_use_for_ai: Specialized index for astronomy and astrophysics research literature. Authoritative source for astronomical publications.
notes: Maintained by Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics. Free access.

name: Papers With Code
suggested_use_for_ai: Primary verification layer linking arXiv papers to implementations and datasets. Track SOTA performance across thousands of tasks.
notes: JSON exports and API enable automated state-of-the-art queries. Essential for reproducibility verification.

name: Distill
suggested_use_for_ai: Tier-S standard for mechanistic interpretability. Provides granular dissection of neural network behaviors with interactive explanations.
notes: Currently on hiatus but archive remains authoritative for interpretability pedagogy. Departed from static PDF to offer explorable explanations.

name: OpenReview
suggested_use_for_ai: Access peer review process for venues like ICLR and NeurIPS. Analyze rejection reasons, flaws identified by experts, reviewer confidence scores.
notes: Provides structured metadata on acceptance rates, decision signals, and scientific critique.

name: ScienceDirect
suggested_use_for_ai: Large database of scientific, technical, and medical journals and books. Strong in engineering, physics, chemistry, and medicine.
notes: Often paywalled; central in many STEM fields. Tier-1 due to paywall constraints for AI systems.

name: SSRN (Social Science Research Network)
suggested_use_for_ai: Major preprint and working-paper repository for economics, law, finance, and social sciences. Expanding into other fields.
notes: Free access to abstracts; growing open-access initiatives.

name: ACM Digital Library
suggested_use_for_ai: ACM conferences and journals on AI, software engineering, and systems. Source for SIGAI, CHI, and CSCW research.
notes: Tier-1 due to paywall; institutional access often required.

name: IEEE Xplore
suggested_use_for_ai: IEEE conferences and journals on AI system engineering, neural networks, and computer vision.
notes: Tier-1 due to paywall; institutional access often required.

name: Journal of Machine Learning Research (JMLR)
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical peer-reviewed open-access journal for all ML/AI including system design, architectures, benchmarks, and theory.
notes: Open access. High standard. Often cited as gold-standard ML venue.

name: Nature Machine Intelligence
suggested_use_for_ai: Top interdisciplinary, peer-reviewed journal for AI theory, systems, and applied intelligence.
notes: Tier-1 due to paywall; Nature brand prestige.

name: OpenAI Research
suggested_use_for_ai: Primary source for GPT family, DALL-E, Sora, and RL algorithms (PPO, SAC). Includes educational resources like 'Spinning Up in Deep RL'.
notes: Straddles academic paper and product announcement. Includes system cards and safety evaluations.

name: Google DeepMind Research
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical source for AI for Science (AlphaFold, GraphCast), multimodal systems, and RL applications to robotics and physical systems.
notes: Focuses on cutting-edge applications and alignment research.

name: Stanford HAI (Human-Centered AI)
suggested_use_for_ai: Intellectual hub for AI ethics and policy. Annual AI Index Report provides macro-level statistics on compute costs, patents, and global adoption.
notes: Interdisciplinary collaboration on AI risk mitigation, bias, and hallucination.

name: Berkeley BAIR Blog
suggested_use_for_ai: High-signal technical resource for robotics and control theory. Accessible yet rigorous summaries of top-conference papers.
notes: Emphasizes pedagogical clarity alongside technical depth.

name: Lil'Log (Lilian Weng)
suggested_use_for_ai: Tier-S meta-resource by OpenAI researcher. Comprehensive literature reviews on LLM Agents, Hallucinations, Diffusion Models. Acts as high-quality summarization nodes.
notes: Personal blog but widely recognized as authoritative. Aggregates scattered research into coherent frameworks.

name: PyTorch Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical reference for tensor operations and dynamic computational graphs. Essential for production-grade ML code.
notes: Split between Stable and Beta channels. Updated synchronously with codebase.

name: Hugging Face
suggested_use_for_ai: Central repository for transformers, datasets, and huggingface_hub libraries. Details on model cards, uploads/downloads, and Inference API.
notes: 'GitHub of Machine Learning'. Normative instructions for CLI interaction and artifact management.

name: LangChain Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Orchestration layer for LLMs. Essential for 'Chain' abstraction and LangGraph control flow. Integration points for LLM providers.
notes: Central to agentic workflow design.

name: LlamaIndex Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Authority on RAG and data ingestion. Patterns for connecting external data sources (SQL, PDF, APIs) to vector stores. LlamaParse and LlamaExtract for unstructured data.
notes: Essential for AI systems requiring external knowledge integration.

name: Python Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Authoritative reference for Python language, standard library, and official best practices. Version-specific documentation.
notes: Maintained by Python Software Foundation. Definitive source for official APIs.

name: MDN Web Docs
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical reference for web standards (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, browser APIs). Well-maintained and community-driven.
notes: Open-source and community-maintained. Authoritative source for web technologies.

name: React Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Official documentation for React components, hooks, and patterns. Canonical guidance on React implementation.
notes: Maintained by Meta/Facebook. Up-to-date with latest React versions.

name: Next.js Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Official documentation for Next.js routing, data fetching, and deployment. Framework-specific features and patterns.
notes: Maintained by Vercel. Covers server-side rendering and production deployment.

name: TypeScript Documentation
suggested_use_for_ai: Official TypeScript reference for type system, compiler options, and configuration. Authoritative syntax and tooling guidance.
notes: Maintained by Microsoft. Comprehensive handbook and reference.

name: DevDocs
suggested_use_for_ai: Aggregates hundreds of official docs (languages, frameworks, libraries) into unified, fast, offline-friendly interface.
notes: Instant search across multiple documentation sources. Tier-1 as a meta-aggregator rather than authoritative source.

name: Wolfram MathWorld
suggested_use_for_ai: Comprehensive math encyclopedia with definitions, theorems, formulas, and visualizations across pure and applied mathematics.
notes: Authoritative and widely cited. Created by Wolfram Research.

name: OEIS (On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences)
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical database for identifying and exploring integer sequences. Essential for combinatorics, number theory, and sequence identification.
notes: Maintained by OEIS Foundation. Millions of sequences with cross-references.

name: PlanetMath
suggested_use_for_ai: Community-driven math encyclopedia emphasizing peer review, rigor, and community. Alternative explanations for mathematical topics.
notes: Less polished than MathWorld but community-maintained with open licensing.

name: Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy
suggested_use_for_ai: Peer-reviewed, expert-maintained reference work with nearly 1,800 entries on philosophical topics. Citable source for academic work.
notes: Articles written and maintained by domain experts. Continuously updated.

name: Project Gutenberg
suggested_use_for_ai: Library of 75,000+ digitized public-domain books proofread by volunteers. Access to classic literature and historical texts.
notes: Free and openly licensed. Since 1971.

name: Internet Archive (Texts)
suggested_use_for_ai: Huge repository of scanned books and documents. Especially strong in historical and out-of-print works. Full-text search available.
notes: Coverage is unmatched but quality varies. Tier-1 due to variable accuracy.

name: Perseus Digital Library
suggested_use_for_ai: Tufts University's digital library with Greek and Roman texts, aligned translations, and lexical tools. Extended collections on other topics.
notes: Scholarly resource with rigorous text curation and annotation.

name: Internet History Sourcebooks
suggested_use_for_ai: Fordham University project providing public-domain and copy-permitted historical texts across civilizations. Widely used educational resource.
notes: Curated collections across ancient, medieval, and modern history.

name: PubChem
suggested_use_for_ai: Free NCBI database of chemical molecules and bioactivity data. API-accessible for programmatic retrieval.
notes: Maintained by NCBI. Machine-readable API for chemical data.

name: NASA Science
suggested_use_for_ai: Authoritative portal for mission information, datasets, and educational resources on space and Earth science.
notes: Official NASA science portal with publicly available data.

name: Khan Academy
suggested_use_for_ai: Free, world-class education through structured lessons, videos, and practice. Covers K-12 and early college math, science, and humanities.
notes: Nonprofit with strong reputation for clarity and pedagogy.

name: MIT OpenCourseWare
suggested_use_for_ai: Free course materials from MIT covering math, CS, engineering, physics, and more. University-level rigor with open licensing.
notes: 2,500+ courses available. Self-paced learning.

name: Coursera
suggested_use_for_ai: MOOC platform with courses, specializations, and degrees from universities and industry partners. Mix of free audit and paid certificates.
notes: Large catalog with structured learning paths.

name: edX
suggested_use_for_ai: Nonprofit MOOC platform founded by MIT and Harvard. University-level courses and professional programs.
notes: Founded by top universities with commitment to accessibility.

name: freeCodeCamp
suggested_use_for_ai: Open-source curriculum for learning to code. Project-based learning with emphasis on practical skills.
notes: Community-driven with strong reputation for hands-on coding.

name: Open Culture (Course Index)
suggested_use_for_ai: Curated directory pointing to free university courses, lectures, and podcasts from major institutions.
notes: Aggregator of open educational resources.

name: GitHub
suggested_use_for_ai: Largest code-hosting platform. Primary source for real-world open-source code examples and implementation patterns. Read issues and PRs to understand actual API usage.
notes: De facto standard for OSS. API enables programmatic access.

name: Sourcegraph
suggested_use_for_ai: Semantic code search engine. Find usage patterns and API examples across large codebases. Tier-1 as specialized secondary to GitHub.
notes: Enables semantic code navigation and pattern discovery.

name: Stack Overflow
suggested_use_for_ai: Massive Q&A archive for practical coding issues, error messages, and edge cases across all programming languages and frameworks.
notes: Community-driven with peer curation. Practical and immediate focus.

name: IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force)
suggested_use_for_ai: Canonical source for internet protocols and standards (HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, TLS, etc.). RFCs define foundational network behavior.
notes: Open standards body. RFCs are immutable reference points.

name: W3C (World Wide Web Consortium)
suggested_use_for_ai: Standards body for web technologies: HTML, CSS, XML, Web APIs, WebAssembly, etc. Technical reports are authoritative.
notes: International community consensus on web standards.

name: NIST AI Risk Management Framework
suggested_use_for_ai: Government framework for AI risk management. Authoritative guidance on responsible AI development and deployment.
notes: US government standard. Applicable to AI systems in regulated contexts.

name: OWASP (Open Worldwide Application Security Project)
suggested_use_for_ai: Community-driven security guidelines including OWASP Top 10 for web application security. Applicable to AI system deployment.
notes: Tier-1 as a secondary to NIST for AI; primary for general application security.
